page.title: 06St. Andrew's Church
page.content: St. Andrew's, the parish church of Gorleston, dates from the 16th century. Each week 400-500 people meet there to worship. The congregation ranges from toddlers to the very elderly. Church organisations meet there during the week: beavers, cubs, scouts, girls brigade, over 60s, Ladies Club, Mother's Union, Youth Club, Quest Club(7-11), instrumental music club, church choir. Church members and others are involved in these activities. Over 100 people attend bible study and prayer groups. The church is a centre for voluntary community work and for advice for the unemployed.
